title: How to Set Up a Virtual Private Network with Windows

steps.headline: Open your web browser and go to www.whatismyip.com.
steps.description: Write down the IP address. You will need it to configure the client.

steps.headline: Click the Start button and click Run.
Type control and hit Enter.
Click Network and Internet Connections.
Click Network Connections.
Click Create a New Connection, which is the first option on the left toolbar.
The New Connection Wizard will open.
Choose Set up an advanced connection, the last element on the list.
Choose Accept incoming connections.
You will see the Devices for Incoming Connections screen.
steps.description: Do not select anything on this screen. Click Next.

steps.headline: Select Allow virtual private connections.
Select to whom you want to give access.
steps.description: Click Next. If a user is not listed, you will have to add an account. See “Related Wikihows” for more information.

steps.headline: Do not change anything on the Networking Software screen.
That's it!
steps.description: Your computer is now set up to allow for VPNs. Click Finish to complete the wizard.

steps.headline: Click the Start button and click Run.
Type control and hit Enter.
Click Network and Internet Connections.
Click Network Connections.
Click Create a New Connection, which is the first option on the left toolbar.
The New Connection Wizard will open.
Select Connect to the network at my workplace  and click Next.
Select Virtual Private Network connection  and click Next.
Type the name of your network in the blank box.
Enter the IP address  you wrote down earlier and click Next.
Select Add a shortcut to this connection to my desktop  and click Finish.
